listitem.para: Whether pluto should produce Linux Auditing System log messages. If enabled, pluto will log start, stop and fail for the negotiation of IKE and IPsec SA's. The kernel will also log success and failures for actually adding and removing IPsec SA's from the kernel's SADB. Valid options are yes(the default) and no. On non-Linux systems, this option is ignored. If enabled but the kernel is lacking audit support, audit messages are not sent. If the kernel has audit support and using it fails, pluto will abort. Note that for compliance reasons, audit log messages contain the relevant IP addresses, even if logip=no.
